title: What is the meaning and relevance of history in the Philippines? - Quora

response.answer_text: It mainly gives you the most important element when you find yourself in situations you need to deal with history (even if the topic makes you sleep or even worst, quitting from your life) of the Philippines: CONTEXT. Of course, it's so uncool thinking and talking about history and you just focus on memorizing facts. You go beyond that: you seek meaning and relevance when you know the context. However, context can only be derived, understood, and used to your advantage if you spend time reading, writing, studying history. I know that's a lot of work, especially if you're already hungry, poorly paid, being taken advantaged of, or being largely ignored. It's up to you. History is really just the past in its most basic form. But to ignore it continuously, you will fail to see valuable and instructive lessons you need to navigate the present. When you learn very well enough, you have better chances of having a great future. However, that's no guarantee as life is really meant to be lived well right now, rather than being scared, inutile, powerless, ashamed and humiliated that some of us seemingly prefer to live in a state with.
Studying our history would teach you about our origins as a people… so kindly study. Dayang C Marikit's answer to What are some remarkable ancient civilizations most people don't know about?
